title: Philae
description: An ancient island located just above the first cataract of the Nile that was flooded by the construction of the Aswan High Dam. The island was home to a multi-period temple complex, which was moved to the nearby island of Agilkia and declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in the 1970s.

properties.description: The visible remains of the temple complex from Philae island, relocated to Agilkia Island in a UNESCO effort. Temples are of Ptolemaic date, and continued in use during the Roman empire, but time period associated with this location has been set to "modern" because it is not the original location.
properties.title: View of the Relocated Philae temple
